intro: Sarcanthus pugioniformis, commonly known as the swordleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens despite its toxic properties.
